page.title: 03CRAG BANK COMMUNITY PROJECT
page.content: In 1983/84 Crag Bank, an outskirt of Carnforth,decided it needed a new hall, the existing hall was getting beyond repair. The Village Hall committee led by{Cllr H. Buxton} applied for numerous grants from the local authorities,sports councils and charities. With this money the M.P.S. agreed to build the hall. Work took 14 months and ended in the spring of 1985.Many materials were donated or bought cheaply. With the M.P.S. labour this produced a 26m. x19m. steel structure clad with metal sheets. The front is of red brick with hard wood windows. It cost Â£31,500 to build and is worth Â£100,000. It is used for all village activites such as the W.I., discos, guides and various meetings and functions. The large hall will also be used for Badminton, Keepfit, 5-a-side football and indoor bowls.
